quest.name: Put to the Proof
objectives: Find the first statue in the ruins of Ronka.
Find the second statue in the ruins of Ronka.
Find the third statue in the ruins of Ronka.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: That Eulmore has gained a foothold here does not bode well for the Night's Blessed.

dialogue.name: RYNE
dialogue.text: There must be something we can do to help the Night's Blessed... Mustn't there?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: How fareth the young guard?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The poison spread throughout his system long before he was brought here. At present, there is naught we can do but try to ease his pain.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Do not blame yourselves, my friends. All that can be done has been done.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Even had we reached him sooner, it would have made little difference. The Children employ countless poisons. Finding a suitable antidote is a nigh impossible task.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...What of the rest of the Blessed? How have they taken the news of Eulmore's generous proposition?

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: With anger and dismay. We cannot hope to oppose both them and the Children.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: I considered a convocation of all the Night's Blessed that we might consider their ultimatum, but I know how they will answer.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Master Matoya...I am truly sorry.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: We will not─cannot─abandon our faith.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: But there is no reason for you to suffer for our decision. Your work is not yet done, and you still have time to flee.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: ...Flee?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I am not wont to run from my troubles. In fact, with Forename's arrival, I am minded to take the offensive.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Eulmorans' presence here plainly stems from a desire to protect the Lightwarden. I say we seek it out and slay the creature before they return.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Were darkness to fall over Rak'tika, they would have no cause to remain.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: ...All of which is rather easier said than done. Unless, of course, you've finally deciphered that tablet?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I have, as a matter of fact. And with it we can prepare everything we need to enter Yx'Maja.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: What say you all? We will need to act quickly, but I believe it can be done.

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: We cannot deny our fate. But one course lieth before us.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: We slay the Lightwarden.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: For the Night's Blessed!

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Well, we are villains, are we not?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Good. I leave the Blessed in your capable hands, Runar.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Very well...

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: I see there is no changing your mind. By all that is dark, I swear to keep the Blessed safe.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: According to the tablet, we will first need to obtain a seal used to identify the allies of Ronka in times past.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: One such seal should be waiting for us in a complex of underwater ruins not far from here. You have some experience with subaquatic excursions, do you not?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Then this should prove a simple task for you. The ruins we seek are at the bottom of Lake Tusi Mek'ta.

dialogue.name: THANCRED
dialogue.text: While you see to that, Minfilia and I will remain here to help shore up Slitherbough's defenses.

dialogue.name: RUNAR
dialogue.text: Your aid would be greatly appreciated.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: There you are. Ready for a swim?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The seal we seek should be stored in a chamber somewhere inside the ruins beneath the lake.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: However, the entrance is seemingly protected by a subtle locking mechanism rooted in the symbolism of Ronkan culture.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The Ronkans sought to live in harmony with nature, and considered certain animals to be sacred. Foremost in their pantheon was the snake, portrayed as the protector of the wood, and arbiter of life and death. Below it were four others, each equal in rank: the coeurl, the colibri, the opo-opo, and the wolf, characterized as the bringers of liberty, words, enlightenment, and harmony, respectively.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: To open the chamber containing the seal, the tablet states that one must pay due deference to three of these beasts by placing one's palm on monuments wrought in their image, and that this must be done in a specific sequence.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: If my interpretation is correct, the order can be discerned from the three commandments which follow.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Give praise unto the snake. By its strength do our lands prosper.”

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Be as the opo-opo, rival thy kin. As all parts seek betterment, so too does the whole.”

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Be as the wolf, move as one. Peace comes to all who seek harmony with their kin.”

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The tablet says naught of the placement, size, or appearance of the monuments, alas. Hopefully all will become clear when you reach the bottom of the lake. Go safely.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: You have forgotten the sequence? <sigh> Mind that you listen this time, yes? The commandments were as follows...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Give praise unto the snake. By its strength do our lands prosper.”

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Be as the opo-opo, rival thy kin. As all parts seek enlightenment, so too does the whole.”

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: “Be as the wolf, move as one. Peace comes to all who seek harmony with their kin.”

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: As I told you before, the tablet says naught of the position, size, or appearance of the monuments in question, so you will just have to use your eyes.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a statue of a snake.

dialogue.name: Q2
dialogue.text: Place your palm on the snake statue?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You sense something stir elsewhere in the lake.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a statue of an opo-opo.

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Place your palm on the opo-opo statue?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You sense something stir elsewhere in the lake.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a statue of a coeurl.

dialogue.name: Q4
dialogue.text: Place your palm on the coeurl statue?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You sense a malign magick emanating from the monument.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a statue of a wolf.

dialogue.name: Q5
dialogue.text: Place your palm on the wolf statue?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: Once more, you sense something stir elsewhere in the lake. Perhaps the chamber containing the seal is open.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You find a statue of a colibri.

dialogue.name: Q6
dialogue.text: Place your palm on the colibri statue?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: You sense a malign magick emanating from the monument.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: I sensed a stirring in the water. Assuming you've found the chamber, it may be wise to check the entrance.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: A door opens to reveal a pedestal upon which rests a medallion. You take it and secure it inside your clothing.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Did you find it?

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: This medallion... It bears the owl insignia of the empire. There can be no doubt─this is the seal of Ronka.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Well done, Forename. We can begin our preparations to enter Yx'Maja in earnest.
